msContents.summary: The Kantapurāṇakatai appears to be a prose epitome of the Kantapurāṇam of Kacciyappa Civācāriyar, departing somehow from this version. For instance, at the end of Kacciyappa Civācāriyar’s, after marrying Vaḷḷi, Murukaṉ brings her near the Kailāsa mountain, introduces her to his first spouse Teyvayāṉai, and the three of them live afterwards in harmony. In the present Kantapurāṇakkatai, Murukaṉ and Vaḷḷi join Teyvayāṉai in Centippaṭṭaṇam (f48v10), that is Centil/Tiruccentūr, where they all live happily.

origin.origDate: 1729 at the latest. 1750 according to Cabaton (1942, p.49).

provenance.p: It appears to be le livre appelé le Candapouranam Cadey, qui est l'histoire de Souprânien and Le Candapouranam Kadey sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1730 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in ancien lists (BnF NAF 5442, f5r and f9r).

p.p: Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.
